data.ability: After each time a minion is played here, its owner may play an extra minion of power 2 or less.
After this base scores, the winner may return one of his or her minions of power 3 or less from here to his or her hand.
(no ability)
After each time a minion is destroyed here, place it at the bottom of its owner‚Äôs deck.
After this base scores, the winner may destroy any one minion.
After this base scores, place each player‚Äôs highest power minion here on the bottom of its owner‚Äôs deck.
After this base scores, all players other than the winner may move a minion from here to another base instead of the discard pile.
The runner up may move one of his or her minions to the base that replaces this base.
When this base scores, the winner gains 1 VP for every 5 power that player has here.
Each minion here has +1 power.
After each time a minion is destroyed here, its owner gains 1 VP.
At the start of each player‚Äôs turn, that player may move one other player‚Äôs minion from any base to here.
After this base scores, the winner looks at the top three cards of the base deck, chooses one to replace this base, aneturns the others in any order.
After this base scores, all players with minions here may draw one card.
After this base scores, the winner discards his or her hand and draws five cards.
When this base scores, each player gains 1 VP for each minion that player has here.
When one or more minions here are destroyed, the player who destroyed them gains 1 VP.
Minions of power 2 or less cannot be played here.
After a player plays a minion here, that player must discard a card.
Players cannot play actions on this base.
On your turn, you may play one extra minion of power 2 or less here.
The winner may search his or her deck for a minion and play it on the base that replaces this one.
The winner may take an action from his or her discard pile and place it in his or her hand.
When a player plays an action card on this base, that player may play an extra action.
Players cannot play more than one minion on this base each turn.
After the first time a player plays a minion here each turn, they can play an extra minion of the same name here.
After each time a minion is played here, its owner may place one card from any player‚Äôs discard pile on the bottom of their deck.
After this base scores, all minions on it are shuffled into their owners‚Äô decks instead of their discard piles.
After each time a minion is played here, its owner draws a Madness card.
At the start of each player‚Äôs turn, that player may destroy one of their minion‚Äôs here. If they do, they gain 1 VP.
After each time a minion is played here, its owner may return a Madness card from their hand to the Madness deck.
After this base scores, the winner may search their hand and discard pile for any number of Madness cards, and return them to the Madness deck.
Minions here get +1 power for each action played on them.
The winner may place his or her actions played on minions here back into his or her hand.
Once per turn, after you play a minion here, search your deck for a copy of that minion, reveal it, and place it into your hand. Shuffle your deck.
You may not play a minion here that has the same name as another minion here.
The winner may look at the top three cards of his or her deck and return them in any order.
Before this base scores, all players reveal the top card of their decks. Play all revealed minions here.
The winner takes an extra turn after the current turn ends.
The winner replaces this base with a base of his or her choice from the base discard pile, if possible.
Minions here with +1 power counters cannot be destroyed.
At the start of each player‚Äôs turn, that player may move one of his or her minions from any base to here.
The winner places a +1 power counter on each of his or her minions.
The first minion played here each turn gets a +1 power counter.
After you play a minion here, if another player has more power here than you do, you may place a +1 power counter on that minion.
When one or more minions here are destroyed the player who destroyed them may place a +1 power counter on one of his or her minions here.
The first minion played here each turn gains +2 power until the end of the turn.
During your turn, one of your minions here can use its Talent twice.
After you play an action on a minion here, draw a card.
After the first time you play a minion here each turn, you may play an extra minion here or play an extra action.
Once during your turn, you may destroy one of your minions here to draw a card.
If a minion at another base would be destroyed, its owner may move it here instead.
After you play a minion here, you may move one of your minions from another base to here.
If you have two or more minions here, your minions here cannot be destroyed.
Minions here with power 5 or greater are not affected by opponents‚Äô cards.
Minions cannot be played here.
2 Monsters - After this base scores, place minions here on top of their owners‚Äô decks, in any order, instead of the discard pile.
3 Monsters - After an undead monster is played here, place it on the bottom of the monster deck.
2 Monsters - Minions here have +1 power for each treasure on them.
1 Monster - After the first time each turn that you play a minion here, draw a treasure card.
2 Monsters - During each player‚Äôs turn, other players‚Äô minions here have +1 power.
2 Monsters - After you play a minion here, choose another player. That player may draw a card.
1 Monster - If you do not have a minion here, you cannot play a minion on another base.
1 Monster - On your turn, if you have no minions on this base, you may play an extra minion here.
1 Monster - Each turn, after the first time you play a minion here, you may discard a card to play an extra minion here.
1 Monster - After you play a minion here, you may draw a card.
2 Monsters - When this base scores, if the total of all players‚Äô power here is 22 or more, the players with the top three totals each gain 1 VP.
2 Monsters - Minions here are not affected by other players‚Äô actions.
2 Monsters - When this base scores, each player with a minion here draws a treasure card.
1 Monster - After you play a treasure on this base or on a minion here, draw a card.
3 Monsters - After you destroy a monster here, draw a treasure card.
3 Monsters - After a monster here is destroyed, play a monster here.
The winner draws 3 cards.
Each minion here has -1 power.
After you play a minion here, reveal the top card of your deck. If it is an action, draw it; otherwise return it.
After any player plays an action, he or she may give a minion here +2 power until the end of the turn.
After a minion is destroyed here, the player that destroyed it may place a +1 power counter on one of their minions.
After you play a minion of power 4 or more here, you may destroy a minion with less power here.
Minions of power 2 or less cannot be destroyed here except by their controller.
After you play a minion here, you may place a minion from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck.
After the first time you play a minion here each turn, you may move another minion to here from another base.
After you move a minion to here, place a +1 power counter on it.
After the first time each turn that you play an action that directly increases the power of one of your minions here, draw a card.
Before this base scores, place a random other base and all cards on it in the discard pile. Replace it with the top card of the base deck.
After a minion here uses a talent, it gains +1 power until the end of the turn.
Before this base scores, replace it with the top card of the base deck. Keep all cards on it, discard this card, and keep scoring.
At the end of any turn that a player has played at least one minion here, they may destroy a minion they own to draw a card.
After you play a minion here, you may give control of it to another player.
Minions here are not affected by other players‚Äô minions here.
At the start of your turn, you may move one of your minions to here, or from here to another base.
At the start of your turn, if you have only one minion here, it gains +5 power while it is here until the end of the turn.
At the start of your turn, if you have a minion here, gain 1VP.
After you play a minion here, look at the top card of your deck. Place it on the top or bottom of your deck.
After this base scores, each player may place one of their minions here on the top or bottom of their deck instead of the discard pile.
After you play or move a minion to here, it gains +1 power until the end of the turn.
Before this base scores, each player may move one of their minions to here.
Before this base scores, each minion here gains +1 power until the end of the turn.
On your turn, you may play an extra minion of power 2 or less here if you have played one or more minions at other bases this turn.
You may play an extra minion of power 2 or less here on your turn. If you control it at the end of the turn, place it on the bottom of your deck.
After the first time you play a minion here each turn, you may shuffle a random minion from your discard pile into your deck.
Titans here do not make other titans leave. Each titan here adds +3 power to its controller‚Äôs power here.
After you play an action on this base, you gain +3 power here until the end of the turn.
After you play a minion here, your other minions here gain +1 power until the end of the turn.
Before this base scores, each player destroys all of their minions and actions on this base but one card total.
Before this base scores, each player with a minion here gains +2 power here for each special ability they use before scoring.
After this base is played, each player reveals the top card of their deck. If it is a minion,they may play it here as an extra minion.
After a player plays a standard action that affects one or more of their minions here, they draw a card.
Once per turn, when your standard action directly affects one or more of your minions here, you may have it affect another of your minions here the same way.
After you play a minion here, place a +1 power counter on each of your minions here with less power than that minion.
When this base scores, the winner gains 1VP for each player with no power here.
When an action played on this base would go to the discard pile, shuffle it into its owner‚Äôs deck instead.
At the start of your turn, you may transfer an action played on another base to here, or from here to another base.
Minions here cannot be affected by other players‚Äô cards.
After a player plays an action that affects a card here, each other player may place a +1 power counter on a minion here.
The winner draws 3 cards, then discards 2 cards.
When a minion is played here, other minions here of that faction gain +1 power until the end of the turn.
At the start of your turn, if you have a minion here, draw a card.
After a minion here is destroyed, its controller draws a card.
On your turn, you may bury a card from your hand here.
After a card is buried here or an action is played on this base, its controller draws a card.
After a minion here is destroyed, each player with a minion here may draw a card.
After you play a minion here, it may duel another player‚Äôs minion here. Destroy the losing minion.
Each turn, the first time one of your minions here goes to the discard pile, draw a card.
After you play a minion here, it may duel another player‚Äôs minion here. The controller of the winning minion draws two cards.
The first time each turn a player plays a minion here, they may reveal the top card of another player‚Äôs deck. If it is an action, or a minion of power 3 or less, they may place it into their hand.
On your turn, you may place a card from your hand on top of your deck to give one of your minions here +2 power until the end of the turn.
After you play an action that directly affects another player‚Äôs minion here, draw a card.
After the first time you play a minion here each turn, you may place a random action from your discard pile into your hand.
Before this base scores, each player may move one of their minions from here to another base and give it +1 power until the end of turn.
After you play a minion here, you may move another player‚Äôs minion to here from a base where you have a minion.
Once per turn after you play an action that directly affects one of your minions here, you may play an extra action.
At the end of your turn, if you have a minion here, draw a card.
At the start of your turn, you may discard a card to place a +1 power counter on one of your minions here.
After the first time you play a minion here on your turn, you may move another player‚Äôs minion from here to another base.
At the start of your turn, you may place one of your minions here on the bottom of your deck to play a minion off the top of your deck as an extra minion.
After the first time you play a minion here on your turn, you may play a minion off the top of your deck here as an extra minion.
If you have a minion here, after the first time each turn you play a standard action, you may place it into another player‚Äôs hand instead of the discard pile to draw two cards.
On your turn, you may play an extra action to place a counter on this card. This base‚Äôs breakpoint is reduced by 2 for each of those counters.
This base‚Äôs breakpoint is reduced by 3 for each action on it.
After you play an action on this base, draw a card.
Before this base scores, each player may choose two of their minions here with the same power to gain +2 power until the end of the turn.
Once per turn, after you play a minion here, search your deck for a minion of power 3 or less and place it into your hand.
After this base scores, replace it with two bases instead of one.
At the start of your turn, if you have exactly one minion here, place a +1 power counter on it.
If each player has one or more minions on this base, its starting breakpoint is 0.
This base‚Äôs breakpoint is reduced by 1 for each minion on it.
Once during your turn, after you play a minion here, you may place it on the bottom of its owner's deck to play a minion off the top of your deck here as an extra minion.
Characters here of power 5 or more are not affected by other players' actions.
After you play a character here, you may place a character from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck.
After one or more of your characters here is destroyed, draw a card.
After the first time each turn you play a character of power 2 or less here, you may play an extra character of power 2 or less here.
On your turn, if you have a character here, you may play an extra action.
After the first time you play a character here each turn, draw a card.
Before this base scores, each player may move one of their characters here to another base to gain 1 VP.
When this base scores, players other than the winner gain 1 VP for each character they have here.
On your turn, if you have a character here, you may move one of your other characters from another base to here.
On your turn, you may play a character of power 2 or less here as an extra character.
After you play a base modifier here, draw a card.
This base‚Äôs breakpoint is reduced by 1 for each base modifier on it.
After this base scores, each player with a character here may place a card with a Special ability from their discard pile on top of their deck.
After you play a character here, you may look at the top card of your deck and place it on the top or bottom of your deck.
After you move a character to here, it gains +2 power until the end of the turn.
After you play a character here, you may move one of your characters from another base to here.
After this base scores, each player with a minion here may flip a coin. If heads, they gain 1 VP. If tails, they discard two cards.
After you play a minion here, flip a coin. If heads, place a +1 power counter on that minion.

data.set: Smash Up Knights of the Round Table
data.ability: Minions here of power 4 or more cannot be affected by other players‚Äô cards. On your turn, you may move one of your minions from here to another base.

data.set: Smash Up Knights of the Round Table
data.ability: Each of your minions here with the same printed power as another one of your minions here has +1 power.
On your turn, you may discard an action card to place up to two +1 power counters total on your characters here.
After the first time you play a character here each turn, draw a card.
After the first time you discard a card from your hand during your turn, place a +1 power counter on one of your characters here.
On your turn, you may discard a card to play an extra character of power 3 or less here.
On your turn, you may move one of your characters with power counters to or from here.
Characters here with power counters have an additional +1 power.
After you play a character here, you may look at the top two cards of your deck, draw one, and place the other in your discard pile.
Characters here cannot be destroyed or moved by other players‚Äô cards.
After the first time you play a character here each turn, you may play an extra action.
At the start of your turn, you may place a +1 power counter on one of your characters here.
Once per turn, after you play a character here, you may place a +1 power counter on it if you have a character of power 4 or more in your discard pile.
After this base scores, the winner may place one of their characters from here or from their discard pile into their hand.
After this base scores, each player may shuffle any number of their modifiers on characters here into their owner‚Äôs decks.
After this base scores, each player with a character here may return a character modifier from here or their discard pile to their hand.
When a base modifier on another base goes to the discard pile, move it to here instead. After this base scores, each player may return one of their base modifiers here to its owner‚Äôs hand.
On your turn, you may move one of your characters to or from this base.
When this base scores, if the total power here equals this base's breakpoint, the winner gains 1 additional VP. (errata'd by 10th Anniversary)
On your turn, if you have a minion here, you may move another player‚Äôs minion to here.
During your turn, other players‚Äô minions here add 1 less power to their controller‚Äôs total.
After this is played, each player may move one of their minions to here. If played during setup, replace it and shuffle it into the deck.
After the first time you move a minion to this base each turn, move another minion from there to here.
Once during your turn, after a minion you own of power 3 or less goes to the discard pile from another base, you may bury it here.
On your turn, you may bury a minion of power 3 or less from your discard pile here.
After the first time you play a minion here during your turn, you may play an extra action or draw a card.
The first minion you play here during your turn gains +2 power until the end of the turn.

At the start of your turn, if you have exactly one minion here, you may reduce the breakpoint of this base by that minion's power until the end of the turn. When this base scores, each player with exactly one minion here gains 1 VP.
The winner may return one of their minions here to their hand.
After the first time you play a minion here each turn, you may place two stasis counters on a card from your hand.
The winner may place two stasis counters on one of their cards here.
After you play a minion here from anywhere except your hand, place a +1 power counter on it.
Before this base scores, starting with the player to the current player's left, each player with a minion here may play an extra minion off the top of their deck here.
Once per turn, after you destroy a card here, draw a card.
The winner may play an extra action or an extra minion on their next turn.
If you have at least two minions here, your minions here each have +2 power.
After you play a minion here, place a +1 counter on one of your minions with a different name here.
